runs.comm: good length outswinger, pushed tentatively into the covers. Bat on ball straightaway
tight to off stump and good movement. Ryder defends with a late adjustment
speared into the pads, and a scampered leg-bye as Ryder misses out with an attempted clip
half a pace down the track, and it's enough to prompt a late adjustment from the bowler, and a leg-side wide
outside off, angling across the right-hander, met with a confident back-foot push through the covers
short, banged into the thigh-pad, and nearly a run-out as Ryder scampers back after backing up too far
massive appeal for lbw, but that must have pitched outside leg stump. Too high as well, probably. Apart from that, stone dead
too short first-up, but Collingwood at point pounces on a sizzling square cut, and that's an undeserved dot ball
smacked high and handsome, clean over the bowler's head. Too full that time, but what a strike!
pushed into the leg-side
width and walloped! That's the sort of striking this kid's reputation has been built on. Like a tracer through the covers
a swing and a miss
good finish to the over. Leg-stump yorker, well dug out
right up in the blockhole, good bowling. Swung out to square leg, but no great timing on that

that's the breakthrough, and it's a clever bit of bowling as well. Sidebottom saw him coming, banged it in, and McCullum's attempted pull cannons off the gloves and loops into the hands of short cover. Timely for England
outside off, left alone
wild down the leg-side

the umpire took an age, but that was plumb! Pitched on middle, nipped back off the seam. Taylor was shuffling across and Gary Baxter was searching for a reason not to give it out. He couldn't find one
tucked up for room by another late-nipping seamer. Hits the pad to a loud appeal, but never close
fired across the right-hander, How stretches for a cut, but his feet are stuck. That is a mighty fine over
fired into the pads
wild, wide, and woolly. But that's a stunning one-handed take from Mustard. Saved four certain wides
fuller length, thumps the pads
better line and length, defended into the covers
Anderson's not got control of this white ball just yet. Another wild leg-side wide, and more good work from Mustard
swinging down leg again, but this time Ryder's pads get in the way
good line and length this time. Full and fast, defended compactly into the covers
yorker, dug out, a momentary hesitation, but the batsmen are home
short and pulled straight between mid-on and the bowler
chopped into the ground and out to point
forward with a firm push into the on side
pushed from a long way in front of the body but again right to the fielder, point this time
cross-batted swat to mid-on
swished to Shah at midwicket, he dived forward full-length but couldn't quite get there
outside off, angled across Ryder who swings and misses
a big heave across the line, Bowden not interested and the ball scoots away for leg byes. It pitched outside leg otherwise that would have been close
down leg, it clips the pads and Mustard makes a good tumbling stop
almost a carbon copy ... down the leg, it brushes the pads and Mustard across quickly to gather on the ground
a big swing - almost a desperate one - gets a top edge and the ball loops down to third man for four. That could have gone anywhere
that got what it deserved, very wide and a thick edge from Ryder goes shooting along the ground to third man
swished over midwicket, safe and between the two men in the deep
How tries to hit one over long-on but not nearly enough power and Pietersen, two yards in from the rope, doesn't have to move an inch
down the leg side, it flicks the pad and Broad has to slide to prevent the four

pushed off the back foot to cover, no run but Ryder backing up slips, and he's not quick enough to regain his feet and although the throw from Bell was not at the stumps, Mascarenhas had enough time to gather and break the stumps and Ryder was not even in the frame
down the leg side, it flicks the pads and goes fine
pushed to backward point
turns down the leg side, Mustard gathers but the easiest of wides to call
turns past the bat, into the covers, a wild throw from Mascarenhas and Pietersen misses backing up
turned into the leg side
helped round behind square on the leg side
sweetly clipped behind square on the leg side
pushed to Bell at extra cover, and he's in like a shot
swished on the walk to deep midwicket
pushed into the off side
driven on the up, a thick edge goes down to third man
beats a half-hearted push and Mustard, standing up, takes well
Styris heaves across the line, a filthy shot, and he loses his off stump
outside off, Oram fences and misses
a thick edge into the on side gets him off the mark
quick and straight, Oram forced right back to defend
short and Oram sways back out of the line
a long hop pulled to deep midwicket without real oomph
a thick edge races to the third-man boundary
slower ball, Fulton pushes to cover
Fulton back and the ball rattles the top of his off stump he shapes to work it into the leg side
outside off
same line and Mustard gathers
pushed to midwicket
driven uppishly to mid-on, although well short of him
worked fine on the leg side and it beats the man who has come up into the circle
firm drive all along the ground to Pietersen at long-off
angled across the left hander
fuller and pushed to short extra cover
short, pulled to long-on and it falls a foot short of a diving Pietersen who nevertheless does well to pick it up on the half volley
that's the business, short and wide, thumped up and over the covers
good response, on the button and defended
outside off, he shapes for the big hit but bangs it into the ground
up in the blockhole
full again, a drive gets a thick edge and squirts down to wide third man
pushed drive between the close-in cover fielders and through to the man out on the rope
full and a one-handed drive goes up to long-on
driven to long-off, Sidebottom makes good ground and slides to stop the ball a yard in from the rope
backward point misfields and that allows the single
a step and pulled off one knee, it looks to be going all the way but Anderson leaps and parries the ball high above his head and then gathers the rebound. Had he missed, it would have carried for six
reverse sweep, perfectly played
from finesse to brutality, thumped straight and long-on's dive is to no avail
an easy single into the off side
a lot of turn, pushed to cover and a quick single gets him off the mark
patted to long-off
wide, he steps back and the ball comes off the toe-end of the bat into the covers
he steps back and launches that high into the night sky, Mascarenhas comes in ten yards from long-on and takes a good catch as that was coming down from a long way up
flicked square on the leg side, Anderson slides to gather
savage blow, hammered wide of long-on, the ball never got more than six feet off the ground but it flew like a bullet
wide, he has room to free his arms and he batters that straight  down the ground on the off side
good yorker-length delivery, dug out to long-on and they come back for an easy second
hit over mid-on - Pietersen had come up into the circle - and they run three as he gives chase
he steps back and heaves the ball over cow corner, it only just carries but there's nobody out there so all safe
leans back and drives to Pietersen at long-off
Wright follows Patel as he steps to leg, driven to long-off
has to reach to drive the ball over the covers, not enough power to beat deep cover
super end to the over, up in the blockhole and he can do no more than dig the ball back to Wright
Patel goes too far to leg, Anderson holds his line and Patel is left stretching at air
full and outside off, Patel chops down and takes the single to deep cover
wide and swinging wider, Oram gets a thick edge and four to third man
full toss driven to long-on, Patel wanted a second but Oram was not interested
full, straight, and Patel, who has repeatedly been stepping to leg, misses and loses his off stump
pushed into the off side, no follow through, and they take the single. That is a sign that even Oram accepts the game is up.
back, a thick edge down to third man gets Oram back on strike
Oram leans back but doesn't get enough power into the shot and only a single to long-on
pusshed gently to mid-on, Martin sets off, Oram hesitates, the bowler and batsman get tangled, a shy at the stumps misses ... all the fun of the fair
a much slower delivery foxes Oram
slow, wide and a full toss, Oram has to reach so far that he has to take his bottom hand off the bat as he guides it to wide third man
pushed to long-on and once more Martin pinches the strike
back and turned to midwicket, a crazy run - they have no option - but they get away with it as the throw at the bowler's end is wild and wide
wide and full, Oram chops down and squirts the ball to third man ... and turns down the single
fired in at his feet, it passes tow or three inches wide of leg stump as Oram heads to the off and is called a wide
driven to deep cover and another single is turned down. That's hushed the crowd who've been in good spirits

inside edge to fine leg, Sidebottom chases and flicks the ball back a foot inside the rope ... or does he ... the third umpire looks ... and looks ...  the crowd hoot ... and four is given. Sidebottom gives a wry smile and shakes his head
steered to deep backward point
full toss, pushed to long-on and neither batsman shows any interest in the single ... which means that New Zealand need 37 off the final six balls.
powerful shot, leans back and thumps that to the right of long-on
and that's that .. Oram again leans back and looks to thump it over long-off but he doesn't clear Ian Bell who holds onto one that was really flzzing
